caption:
This photograph depicts a man performing on a trombone. The man, possibly in his forties, is wearing a plaid shirt and a patterned tie, complemented by dark trousers and a wristwatch on his left wrist. He wears glasses and is focused intently on playing his instrument. The trombone is brass and shiny, reflecting some light.

The setting appears to be a rehearsal room or a classroom environment, as indicated by the array of empty beige chairs with chrome frames in the background, which are methodically arranged around him. The room also has music stands, and though they are mostly out of focus, one is visible near the foreground on the left side with some sheet music or notebook visible.

The lighting in the room is slightly dim, suggesting an indoor setting, possibly under artificial lighting. The focus of the image is quite sharp on the man and the trombone, while the background fades into a softer focus, helping to draw attention to the main subject and his activity.
title: Band instruction at senior high school in New Ulm Minnesota.  The town is a county seat trading center of 13,000 in a farming area of south central Minnesota.  It was founded in 1854 by a german immigrant land company that encouraged its kinsmen to emigrate from europe.  Several manufacturing firms have located here since 1950 and have helped the town to grow.  The business district was revitalized during the 1960's with community effort
